content:
jwhorvath said
What are the settings for Comcast email in Thunderbird?

Those are decided by the server administrator at Comcast. When folk like you come here and ask about settings, we check one of two things, often both.

The Thunderbird new account wizard database of settings. https://autoconfig.thunderbird.net/v1.1/comcast.net and the providers web site. https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/email-client-programs-with-xfinity-email

Now I have also looked at the Comcast oAuth implementation bug. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1844810 where it looks like Comcast popped in to author the necessary changes to Thunderbird to implement oauth for their customers. It also looks to me to be the part that is not working.

The code is here https://searchfox.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/base/src/OAuth2Providers.sys.mjs#19

Try changing your authentication method to normal password in account settings and try that again. I am assuming it is currently set to oauth.

Can you please post your results here as I think the bug needs some followup.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: We are not a marketing group. Your best approach is to create an account and use it for a few days. I say that because all email clients have features that are best understood by use and exploration. This url may be of some use: https://blog.thunderbird.net/
creator: davidsk

content: "Provider for Google Calendar" was the name of the plugin I had to de-install, just to clarify.
creator: rev3

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content:
Non è normale che ci siano problemi di questo genere così frequentemente. Per dirti io uso Thunderbird da una 20ina di anni e non mi è mai successo nulla del genere. A mio avviso devi cercare la causa di questi problemi esternamente a Thunderbird. È capitato che a volte fosse l'antivirus a cancellare i file di Thunderbird. Altre volte sono stati software per la "pulizia" del sistema operativo (ne usi?). In altri casi era l'effetto di un hard disk a fine vita che corrompeva i dati.

Se vuoi provare a sistemare le cose, c'è questa guida -> https://gioxx.org/2020/01/29/come-gestire-il-profiles-ini-di-firefox-e-thunderbird/

Probabilmente però è più semplice ripartire con un profilo pulito -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird e ripristinare la vecchia posta con i metodi discussi l'altra volta (https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1464387)
creator: @next

content: If your password is being rejected, that is the password that Thunderbird has -- which means it cannot help you. You can locate password at settings>privacy&security by pressing savedpasswords and then showpasswords. But that password doesnt work.
creator: davidsk

content: Do you have more than one account? I suggest you review your SMTP server settings. Click account settings, then scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Servers (SMTP) and review all settings, as one of them appears to still be set to smtp-mail.outlook.com. If true, that also indicates your account settings pane is pointing to the wrong smtp server.
creator: davidsk

content:
New hotmail settings, I believe, are these: -incoming outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 - outgoing smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2

sometimes, you need to exit and restart thunderbird for the Oauth2 to be accepted.
creator: davidsk

content: Please post screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane.
creator: davidsk

content: Clarification - it is not that the sending itself takes half a minute. I can track how long the sending process takes, and it is AFTER the message has been sent that the system hangs - probably during the process of transferring the message into the Sent folder - which should (and used to) be instantaneous.
creator: Lya2

Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode

Does problem behavior change?

content: the svg format is still not universal. l suggest using a common format.

content: Thank you, but what format would you suggest with vector quality?
creator: danuta2

content: My point is that your graphic needs to reach the lowest common format if the goal is that it be seen. That may require redoing the graphic so that it is visible in jpg or png. My assumption is that your goal is communicating to recipients, not showing off perfect graphics.
creator: davidsk

content: In message list, are you using Cards View or Table View? Have you tried Help > Troubleshoot Mode?

content:
More info:

Thanks for the reply. I did have troubleshooting turned on but nothing came of it. My fault maybe.

Anyway: This is weird. Like when your car is doing something bad but the problem doesn't show up at the mechanic's. Thunderbird deletes worked with gmail messages, but failed with Comcast messages. Now, hours later, deleting Comcast emails works OK. File this under self-fixing-problem?

Anyway, I'm marking this problem resolved.
